memberdef.type: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector

memberdef.type: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is
memberdef.definition: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is high

memberdef.type: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is white clipping may occur This can be fixed by reducing either the shininess setting on the Shader or the intensity on the light This product also supports Mecanim To use
memberdef.definition: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is white clipping may occur This can be fixed by reducing either the shininess setting on the Shader or the intensity on the light This product also supports Mecanim To use Mecanim
memberdef.name: Mecanim

memberdef.type: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is white clipping may occur This can be fixed by reducing either the shininess setting on the Shader or the intensity on the light This product also supports Mecanim To use please use the settings below When you select a Mecanim animation in the project
memberdef.definition: GameAssetStudio then right click on it Choose Export Package… Export all of the assets while Include Dependencies Specify an arbitrary directory and a package then create a package file Open a project in which you wish to use the model Select Asset Import Package Custom Package Select the Package you chose the above step and import it Once the model is imported to the it is ready for or _c at the end of their file names divide the animation into respectively Some animations are intended for use with a pair of male or female characters This applies to the following please be sure to use the following settings Method When dragging a model from the project folder to the you must modify the number of bones to use per vertex for skinning Bring the model into the scene and then double click on it In the Inspector Tab look for the Quality setting and change it from Auto to Bones Now you are finished In this procedure must be followed for each model you bring into the scene Method Choose Edit Project Settings Quality In the Inspector choose Other Blend Weights and set that to Bones With this method there is no need to adjust model configurations each time they are brought into the scene Method You can now set the Alpha cutoff of the toon_cutoff shader is the recommended setting Method If your intensity setting on the light is white clipping may occur This can be fixed by reducing either the shininess setting on the Shader or the intensity on the light This product also supports Mecanim To use please use the settings below When you select a Mecanim animation in the project folder
memberdef.name: folder
